entry.name: physique
entry.fluff: Represents the robustness of your body, both in strength and toughness.

entry.name: agility
entry.fluff: How fast and flexible you are. Useful both for avoiding danger, and for stabbing danger in the face.

entry.name: sense
entry.fluff: A measure of your senses, both mundane a magical. One of the fundamental things a mage trains.

entry.name: cunning
entry.fluff: The acuity of your mind. Helps when using magic, or disrupting an opponent's magic.

entry.name: willpower
entry.fluff: Useful when forcing yourself to do things that are boring or painful.

entry.name: warrior spirit
entry.fluff: The Karhun have a long cultural tradition of being warriors. Honorable warriors, perhaps not? But they value the bravery required to get into the thick of things, and the tenacity to stay there.

entry.name: superstition
entry.fluff: The Skuri are fearful and imaginative, which often leads to them seeing imaginary dangers. Superstitious habits are a common result... and shockingly, some of them actually do ward off bad luck!

entry.name: pride
entry.fluff: The Firin tend to have a high opinion of themselves, standards to uphold. Even those not of noble blood. They don't let themselves give up, or make embarrassing mistakes.

entry.name: form
entry.fluff: Learn how to handle weapons more effectively, maximizing how much damage you can do with a solid hit.

entry.name: fury
entry.fluff: Harness your inner fury, your primal desire to smash stuff. Sometimes, a good opportunity to smash just presents itself.

entry.name: combat style
entry.fluff: Learn a formal, polished weapon fighting style. Something bigger than just hitting correctly; something with techniques for things like parrying.

entry.name: skin hardening
entry.fluff: Learn a common warrior technique, training yourself to harden your skin on command by infusing it with astra. Useful, but very painful to learn.

entry.name: organ hardening
entry.fluff: Further improve your skin hardening ability, and learn to apply it to your internal organs to. Makes you a lot tougher, but if you keep it on all the time it'll shorten your lifespan.

entry.name: muscle hardening
entry.fluff: Learn how to use your skin hardening technique on your muscles also, so that not only are you tougher, but you can also push yourself harder without injury.

entry.name: evasion
entry.fluff: Learn how to react quickly to attacks, and effectively move or twist out of the way of them. Dodging is perhaps not as effective as armor, but it does help against weapon and spell both.

entry.name: reflexes
entry.fluff: All attacks can be dodged, even spells. If you are quick enough, you can react to the spell-channel solidifying, and juke away before the spell touches you.

entry.name: combat instincts
entry.fluff: Sharpen your fighting instincts, so that you can not just dodge attacks, but also better react to tiny openings you can exploit for massive damage.

entry.name: celerity
entry.fluff: Learn a common rogue technique that infuses astra into your brain, letting you act just a little bit faster than others.

entry.name: flowing movement
entry.fluff: Train moving while using the celerity technique. It's an acquired skill, but when your mind is moving that little bit faster you can effectively move in ways that would normally be reckless.

entry.name: rapid attacks
entry.fluff: Train using your weapon with the celerity technique active, so that you can best take advantage of the faster thought to land more well-executed attacks.

entry.name: targeting
entry.fluff: Train your eyes to see through the movements of your foes, so you can nail them even as they try to dodge.

entry.name: timing
entry.fluff: Train yourself to have a better sense of timing, so that you always know the right time to make a move.

entry.name: visualization
entry.fluff: Train the eyes of your mind to be as sharp as the eyes on your outside, so you can better translate the shape of a spell-channel from your mind to reality.

entry.name: intuition
entry.fluff: Train your subtler, more instinctual senses... your ability to detect the flow of astra, to guess your way through complicated tasks.

entry.name: natural rhythm
entry.fluff: Get more in touch with the ebbs and flows of your body. This helps with your control of astra, and also aids in the living of a healthy lifestyle.

entry.name: prey instincts
entry.fluff: Learn how to trust in your intuition about the actions of enemies, so that you know the right moment to bolt from the scary thing trying to corner you.

entry.name: study
entry.fluff: Immerse yourself in the theory behind advanced techniques such as magic, to improve your efficacy.

entry.name: hidden tricks
entry.fluff: Leverage your knowledge of magic (and other unusual techniques), to make sure you always have a little something up your sleeve.

entry.name: tactics
entry.fluff: Expand your study to the study of combat tactics, and learn how to control the battlefield in a more martial way.

entry.name: countermagic
entry.fluff: Like how mages can draw spell-channels with their mind, you can disrupt oncoming spell-channels with your mind, cutting perpendicular lines across them.

entry.name: astra absorption
entry.fluff: Learn how to dissipate astra from a spell-channel to further disrupt it. Learning this skill also helps gather more astra from the environment.

entry.name: mage hunting
entry.fluff: Learn an advanced fighting style specifically meant for defeating mages in combat, which combines counter-spelling and dangerous weapon attacks.

entry.name: meditation
entry.fluff: Learn how to meditate, to help you more effectively absorb the astra of the stars during your downtime. A useful skill, especially for mages.

entry.name: wholeness
entry.fluff: Learn a set of advanced meditation techniques that circulate astra through your body as you absorb it. This process helps to improve overall health.

entry.name: combat meditation
entry.fluff: Learn how to tap into that meditative calmness in a fight, to help you stay cool-headed and flexible.

entry.name: vigilance
entry.fluff: Learn how to be patient and focused, so you can effectively react the moment your opponent leaves an opening.

entry.name: discipline
entry.fluff: Train yourself to fight with unwavering discipline, so that you can avoid leaving openings just as well as you exploit those of your opponent.

entry.name: zoning
entry.fluff: Learn how to use your weapon to effectively keep an enemy at bay, even if you aren't using a long weapon like a spear.

entry.name: warrior
entry.fluff: Warriors are those who focus on conventional close-range combat. They learn how to use various weapons and techniques, and how to fight in heavy armor.

entry.name: rogue
entry.fluff: Rogues train in how to fight with a mobile, offensive style. They are strongest when they aren't tied down; for example, when stabbing a foe who is busy fighting someone else.

entry.name: mage
entry.fluff: Mages practice a standardized set of combat magic spells, focusing on sheer magical firepower. They excel at taking down armored foes, who usually lack resistance to magic.

entry.name: mechanic
entry.fluff: Mechanics learn how to maintain and operate Skuri automata. They are most common in civilian life, but some do end up using their skills to deploy deadly combat automata.

entry.name: healer
entry.fluff: Healers learn battlefield-tested Karhun first aid techniques, as well as a scattering of magic. They are perfect supports for a group of warriors.

entry.name: wanderer
entry.fluff: Wanderers learn a traditional Firin fighting style that combines steel and spell. Once taught to noble scions, this style is now practiced by secretive nomads.

entry.name: lab rat
entry.fluff: Lab rats are those who act as test subjects for life-affecting spells, harmful and helpful both. Those who survive often learn the very magic that once tormented them so.

entry.name: martial artist
entry.fluff: Martial artists train in various unarmed combat styles. They are almost always Karhun, who often find the hands-on approach more satisfying.

entry.name: sage
entry.fluff: Sages are the remnants of the old Firin masters of magic theory. They study a variety of specialist spells, and excel at the art of counter-magic.

entry.name: survivor
entry.fluff: Survivors are made, not trained; they pick up a little bit of everything, in their attempts to learn how to live through dangerous situations.

entry.name: gunner
entry.fluff: Gunners learn how to use the pistol, a powerful weapon for the new age. They aren't great at tying enemies down, but their offensive capability is no joke.

entry.name: karhun
entry.fluff: A powerful people who typically live solitary lives in the wilds. When they do band together, though, it's terrifying.

entry.name: firin
entry.fluff: The nomadic remnants of a once-great empire. They still carry an air of easygoing pride with them, even now.

entry.name: skuri
entry.fluff: A secretive and skittish people who prefer to hide themselves away in their grand underground burrows.

entry.name: bald
entry.fluff: When you have fur, the difference between bald and buzzcut is hard to tell.

entry.name: short
entry.fluff: A short, utilitarian haircut. It's not very noteworthy.

entry.name: medium
entry.fluff: Medium-length hairstyles like this are considered fashionable among the Firin.

entry.name: long
entry.fluff: A common Skuri superstition is that cutting your hair is bad luck. Many Skuri wear their hair long, based on that belief.

entry.name: ponytail
entry.fluff: Wearing one's hair in a ponytail is popular with sailors, as it lets you keep your hair out of your eyes even if it has been months since your last trim.

entry.name: karhun
entry.colorationFluff0: Forest Karhun prefer to live in scattered enclaves in the forests, living off the land.
entry.colorationFluff1: River Karhun live by rivers, and are happier with city-life than the forest Karhun. As such, they are the more dominant ethnicity, nowadays.

entry.name: firin
entry.colorationFluff0: The tabby Firin might not have any actual noble heritage, but they still have the bearing of a noble.
entry.colorationFluff1: The reddish coloration ginger Firin was once considered a trait of the royal family. Nowadays, though, it has become quite common.

entry.name: skuri
entry.colorationFluff0: Despite the name, field Skuri rarely actually live outside in fields. Rather, they were once used by the Firin empire as slaves, working the fields.
entry.colorationFluff1: Albinism is much more common in Skuri than it is in other species.

variety.fluff: This old metal rod looks like it was once part of a machine. It could be used as a crude weapon.

variety.name: dagger
variety.fluff: A small, cheaply made dagger.

variety.name: fine dagger
variety.fluff: A higher-quality dagger, made to be extra-sharp.

variety.name: bone dagger
variety.fluff: A dagger carved out of chemically-treated monster bone. Sharp, but a bit hard to hold.

variety.name: blood drinker
variety.fluff: A magical dagger imbued with a continuous spell, a weak form of the siphon spell, so it sucks up the blood of its victims.

variety.name: rusty sword
variety.fluff: A sword that has not been maintained well. The edge is barely sharp anymore.

variety.name: sword
variety.fluff: A basic but effective sword. Well-balanced, and good at parrying.

variety.name: noble sword
variety.fluff: A well-made sword that has been designed to be even better at parrying.

variety.name: firebrand
variety.fluff: A surprisingly dull sword with a powerful enchantment on it. The edge heats up whenever it is swung, to a painful degree.

variety.name: corroded pistol
variety.fluff: This pistol is in such rough shape, it's a wonder that it can fire at all.

variety.name: pistol
variety.fluff: A basic pistol, of a type used by Skuri soldiers.

variety.name: mastercraft pistol
variety.fluff: A pistol made to tight specifications, perhaps for a sharpshooter or similar.

variety.name: golden gun
variety.fluff: A beautiful pistol with a casing made of a gold alloy, enchanted to fire bullets that twist in midair to seek foes. Left behind by a Skuri noble who got tethered.

variety.name: antique mace
variety.fluff: An old mace from who knows where. The heft of this weapon is at least half rust.

variety.name: mace
variety.fluff: A heavy iron mace, meant to smash armored enemies. Not the most subtle of weapons.

variety.name: spiked mace
variety.fluff: A cruel mace that has been modified with metal spikes. It's a little intimidating, really.

variety.name: bronze orbital
variety.fluff: A bronze mace with a strange enchantment on it, which seems to pull it towards enemies. The same enchantment pulls magic towards you, unfortunately.

variety.name: old spear
variety.fluff: A spear that looks like it was used in the old war, and hasn't been cleaned since. It's better than a long stick, but not by much.

variety.name: spear
variety.fluff: A simple spear. Good at punishing enemies for approaching.

variety.name: partisan
variety.fluff: A spear with a special flared head, meant to allow it to parry blows.

variety.name: trembling spear
variety.fluff: This ordinary-looking spear shakes slightly in your hands, making it hard to hold. It's obvious magical, though it's not clear what it is supposed to be for.

entry.name: crimson fangs
entry.fluff: A risky combat technique that tries to rapidly strike the foe's weak spots, often missing in the process.

entry.name: venom sting
entry.fluff: Coat your weapon in poison and make a quick and accurate strike on your foe.

entry.name: slam
entry.fluff: Swing your weapon with more force but less finesse, hitting enemies hard enough to leave them shaken.

entry.name: typhoon slash
entry.fluff: Execute a practiced three-hit combo, trying to overwhelm the opponent with strikes.

entry.name: eye gouge
entry.fluff: Lunge for the opponent's eyes, and cruelly stab into them with your fingers.

entry.name: snipe
entry.fluff: Carefully aim your pistol, and try to read your enemy's movements, then take your shot.

entry.name: inferno shot
entry.fluff: Fire a special bullet that has been coated in incendiary chemicals, meant to light the opponent on fire.

entry.name: wild spark
entry.fluff: Build up your astra and simply release it, without attempting to shape a formal spell. Not very strong, but quite simple to use.

entry.name: arcana arrow
entry.fluff: Build up astra and shape it into the rough shape of an arrow, which you can then launch as a projectile. A basic but effective attack spell.

entry.name: siphon
entry.fluff: Jab your opponent with a thin needle of astra, then drain their blood through the hole. A spell that is subtle and gross in equal measures.

entry.name: phantom flames
entry.fluff: Build up astra, and pattern it with the will to burn others, forming throwable balls of fire-like magic around your hands.

entry.name: ashball
entry.fluff: Scoop up some ash or soot, and flood it with a charge of astra. If you get the technique down, it'll stay together for just long enough for it to be fired at an enemy.

entry.name: sword wave
entry.fluff: Build up astra in your weapon, then release it with a swing. A spell meant to be easy for people who are very used to weapon combat.

entry.name: illusion fist
entry.fluff: Build up some astra in your arm, and then pull it into your hand at the same time as you throw a punch, launching it as a fast-moving projectile. A magical martial arts move.

entry.name: spell barrage
entry.fluff: Build up a large amount of astra and release it in a flurry of magical bolts. A powerful but unsubtle spell.

entry.name: miasma bolt
entry.fluff: Infuse your astra with a toxic quality, and fire it out as a deadly magical bolt.

entry.name: agony release
entry.fluff: Stab yourself with a knife, and use the pain reflex to shape a wicked spell. An unusual but surprisingly effective form of magic.

entry.name: mend
entry.fluff: Build up astra and pattern it with the will and instructions to heal others. An effective use of magic, but watch out for enemies attempting to intercept your spells!

entry.name: first aid
entry.fluff: Apply some basic first aid to an ally, patching up their wounds as best as you can.

entry.name: inner strength
entry.fluff: Build up a large concentration of astra within yourself, and then direct it to circulate through your body, causing rapid regeneration.

entry.name: saw crawler
entry.fluff: Deploy a tough Skuri combat automata armed with a deadly buzzsaw. Not very skillful, but it's an effective distraction.

entry.name: gun turret
entry.fluff: Deploy an immobile Skuri combat automata fitted with an auto-loading gun. Not as tactically flexible as a close-combat automata, but useful when raw firepower is needed.

entry.name: regal cloak
entry.fluff: Wearing this beautiful cloak makes you feel haughty and confident. Was this how the warrior kings of old felt?

entry.name: oilskin cloak
entry.fluff: A leather cloak treated with some kind of slick oil. It'll make it easier to slip away from people.

entry.name: fur cloak
entry.fluff: A warm, fur-lined cloak. Wearing this will help against protect against the elements.

entry.name: third eye
entry.fluff: This piece of jewelry seems purely ornamental at first glance. When worn on the forehead, though, magic within stimulates the wearer's mind, improving alertness.

entry.name: intimidating mask
entry.fluff: A mask with a scary facial expression. If your opponents feel fear upon seeing it, you will soon prove their fear justified.

entry.name: shield
entry.fluff: A simple shield, likely once held by a Karhun soldier. Shields are ineffective against magic, so they aren't all that popular nowadays.

entry.name: lantern
entry.fluff: A rusty old lantern, that once was used to burn some odd oil. It is too foul to light up anymore, but the residue inside seems to dampen magic in some way.

entry.name: silver spectacles
entry.fluff: A seemingly-magical pair of glasses, presumably left behind by someone long dead. Through these lenses, the openings that foes leave stand out in incredibly sharp focus.

entry.name: bloody thorn
entry.fluff: A magical thorn, found safely locked away in a box. Impale the palm of your hand with this and you'll unlock a vengeful power... at the cost of distracting pain.

entry.name: wind bangles
entry.fluff: A set of tarnished golden bangles, with some sort of magic in them that speeds up the legs of the wearer.

variety.name: ragged shirt
variety.fluff: A ratty old shirt that has definitely seen better days. Still, it was made of tough fabric, once.

variety.name: comfortable shirt
variety.fluff: A nice shirt made of a tough but comfortable fabric.

variety.name: regal shirt
variety.fluff: A well-made shirt with fine decorations. Shockingly tough, to protect the bodies of the rich from assassins.

variety.name: rotten jerkin
variety.fluff: This leather jerkin was probably nice once, but now it has begun to dry rot.

variety.name: leather jerkin
variety.fluff: A protective leather jerkin. It's not as good as a breastplate, sure, but it's still a big improvement over normal clothes.

variety.name: fine jerkin
variety.fluff: The leather this jerkin was made of has been treated with chemicals to be tougher, and the make is better. It's a fine jerkin, to be sure.

variety.name: bandit armor
variety.fluff: A crude piece of chest armor cobbled together from scraps. This kind of reckless armor is associated with bandits.

variety.name: elite bandit armor
variety.fluff: A much fancier piece of bandit armor. It's unclear why someone would make this... perhaps they liked the aesthetic?

variety.name: rusty breastplate
variety.fluff: A breastplate that has rusted heavily. It's still effective armor, but it's a little more fragile than if it was intact.

variety.name: iron breastplate
variety.fluff: An old iron breastplate. A powerful piece of defensive gear, if a bit softer than a steel piece.

variety.name: steel breastplate
variety.fluff: A rigid and hard steel breastplate. The standard for protection.

variety.name: ragged hat
variety.fluff: This hat was probably fashionable once. Now, it is barely holding together.

variety.name: comfortable hat
variety.fluff: A common hat. It fits on your head comfortably.

variety.name: regal hat
variety.fluff: This hat is made of a high-quality fabric. It's in mint condition, presumably unworn.

variety.name: rotten cap
variety.fluff: A gross old leather cap. Wash your hair thoroughly after wearing.

variety.name: leather cap
variety.fluff: A protective leather cap. It'll cushion your head a little bit.

variety.name: fine cap
variety.fluff: A quality leather cap with some metal reinforcement inside, for added protection.

variety.name: rusty helmet
variety.fluff: An old helmet that has been rusted over. The flaps for letting your ears through are stuck open, annoyingly.

variety.name: iron helmet
variety.fluff: A cheap helmet made out of iron. Better than nothing.

variety.name: steel helmet
variety.fluff: A well-maintained helmet of shining steel. Useful for keeping your head intact.

variety.name: ragged skirt
variety.fluff: A skirt this old and torn-up would probably be scandalous in normal society. Out here, though... whatever works.

variety.name: comfortable skirt
variety.fluff: This skirt is fairly presentable. Not much as far as armor goes, though.

variety.name: regal skirt
variety.fluff: Even the skirts of nobility had to be knife-proof, back in the old Firin empire. This one is made of a shockingly tough fabric.

variety.name: ragged pants
variety.fluff: A worn-out old pair of pants. At least they don't have any suspicious stains.

variety.name: comfortable pants
variety.fluff: A good, comfortable pair of pants. Nothing exciting about them.

variety.name: regal pants
variety.fluff: These pants are fancy, and made of a surprisingly tough fabric.

variety.name: rotten leggings
variety.fluff: A set of leather leggings that have been weakened by dry rot.

variety.name: leather leggings
variety.fluff: A set of padded leather leggings. They'll provide at least a little protection for your legs.

variety.name: fine leggings
variety.fluff: A nice set of protective leggings, made of high-quality leather treated with special chemicals.

variety.name: rusty armored skirt
variety.fluff: A metal-plated skirt. It's obviously not been maintained correctly.

variety.name: steel armored skirt
variety.fluff: A metal-plated skirt. Not as protective as greaves, or even as leather leggings, but it does leave your legs a lot of room.

variety.name: rusty greaves
variety.fluff: A set of greaves that have obviously seen better days. The knee joints scrape and scream with every move.

variety.name: iron greaves
variety.fluff: A set of cheaply-made iron greaves. Takes some strength to move your legs, in these.

variety.name: steel greaves
variety.fluff: A set of well-oiled steel greaves. No better protection is available for legs.

entry.name: burrow
entry.enemyTemplates: gun turret,saw crawler,paranoid tunneler,paranoid rogue,paranoid mage

entry.name: hedge maze
entry.enemyTemplates: mossy cat,seed spitter,walking topiary,walking bonsai,corpse picker

entry.name: twisted wasteland
entry.enemyTemplates: deadly scavenger,corpse picker,wasteland serpent,poison turtle,monster boar

entry.name: animal pen
entry.enemyTemplates: wasteland serpent,walking topiary,poison turtle,monster boar,tethered healer,tethered rogue,tethered gunner

entry.name: tether assembly
entry.enemyTemplates: tethered warrior,tethered rogue,tethered mage,tethered mechanic,tethered gunner,tethered healer,reinforced gun turret
